name: SSH
description: Run shell commands or a script on a remote machine using SSH
author: Microsoft Corporation

inputs.name: sshEndpoint
inputs.label: SSH service connection
inputs.helpMarkDown: SSH service connection with connection details for the remote machine.

inputs.name: runOptions
inputs.label: Run
inputs.helpMarkDown: Choose to either run shell commands or a shell script on the remote machine.

inputs.name: commands
inputs.label: Commands
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify the shell commands to run on the remote machine. Enter each command along with its arguments on a new line. To run multiple commands together, enter them on the same line separated by semi-colons (e.g. cd /home/user/myFolder;build).

inputs.name: scriptPath
inputs.label: Shell script path
inputs.helpMarkDown: Path to the shell script file to run on the remote machine.

inputs.name: inline
inputs.label: Inline Script
inputs.helpMarkDown: Write the shell script to run on the remote machine.

inputs.name: interpreterCommand
inputs.label: Interpreter command
inputs.helpMarkDown: Path to the command interpreter used to execute the script. Adds a shebang line to the beginning of the script. Relevant only for UNIX-like operating systems. Please use empty string for Windows-based remote hosts. [See more about shebang (#!)](https://homepages.cwi.nl/~aeb/std/shebang/unix-faq.txt)

inputs.name: args
inputs.label: Arguments
inputs.helpMarkDown: Arguments to pass to the shell script.

inputs.name: failOnStdErr
inputs.label: Fail on STDERR
inputs.helpMarkDown: If this option is selected, the build will fail when the remote commands or script write to STDERR.

inputs.name: interactiveSession
inputs.label: Enable interactive session
inputs.helpMarkDown: If this option is selected, interactive session will be started - if there's a password request, it will be filled by user's password. It could be useful to run commands like 'sudo'

inputs.name: readyTimeout
inputs.label: SSH handshake timeout
inputs.helpMarkDown: How long (in milliseconds) to wait for the SSH handshake to complete.

validation.message: Enter a valid value for timeout.

messages.ConnectionFailed: Failed to connect to remote machine. Verify the SSH service connection details. Error: %s.
messages.FailedToWriteScript: Failed to write the script to disk: %s
messages.RemoteCmdExecutionErr: Command failed with errors on remote machine.
messages.RemoteCopyFailed: Failed to copy script to remote machine. Error: %s.
messages.RemoteScriptFileCleanUpFailed: Failed to delete the script file copied to the remote machine. Error = %s.
messages.SettingUpSshConnection: Trying to establish an SSH connection to %s@%s:%s
messages.UseDefaultPort: Using port 22 which is the default for SSH since no port was specified.
